title: Can you still buy music on iTunes 2019? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, you can. Except macOS Catalina users, almost people can still buy music from iTunes. With macOS Catalina, Apple is replacing iTunes with three separate apps: Music, TV, and Podcasts. Don’t worry, “Replaced” is the operative word. None of the features are going in the bin, so you can still sync music to your iPod, iPhone and iPad. You'll still be able to buy music.  On Windows, things aren't changing. At least for the moment. So iTunes is still available as a download from the Windows Store. However, this will surely change eventually - it may just be re-skinned to align with the Apple Music app on macOS. The iTunes Store will remain on iOS[1], while you'll still be able to buy music in the Apple Music app on Mac and the iTunes app on Windows. You'll still be able to buy, give and redeem iTunes gift vouchers. While the app will want you to have an Apple Music streaming subscription, you will still have access to your entire music library whether you downloaded the songs, purchased them or ripped them from a CD. The iTunes Music Store will still be accessible through this app. Footnotes[1] iTunes isn't dead, it's just being replaced. Here's what it means for your devices, music and movies
